Legal_Issue: Whether the duty of fairness was breached by failing to disclose the substance of interviews with Faduma and Abdiqani
Credibility_Assessment: Credibility issues due to inconsistencies in the Applicant's statements and discrepancies with relatives' accounts
Legal_Provision: subsection 72(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Inconsistencies in statements and lack of reliance on undisclosed information
Review_Outcome: No breach of procedural fairness found
Legal_Standard: Duty of fairness requires applicants be given opportunity to respond to concerns used in decision
Application_Factor: Credibility concerns based on direct inconsistencies
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Duty of fairness in administrative decision-making
Cause_of_Refusal: Credibility issues arising from inconsistent statements and discrepancies with relatives' accounts
Procedural_Fairness: Applicant had opportunity to address all concerns relied upon; no breach found
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Allegation of breach of duty of fairness
Omission_Type: Failure to disclose non-relied-upon interview details
